reg[31:0]  pc_valid

Detailed Description

Microcode controlled registers.

Most of the ao68000 IP core registers are located in this module. At every clock cycle the microcode controls what to save into these registers. Some of the more important registers include:

  • operand1, operand2 registers are inputs to the ALU,
  • address, size, do_read_flag, do_write_flag, do_interrupt_flag registers tell the bus_control module what kind of bus cycle to perform,
  • pc register stores the current program counter,
  • ir register stores the current instruction word,
  • ea_mod, ea_type registers store the currently selected addressing mode.

Definition at line 1620 of file ao68000.v.

Definition at line 1737 of file ao68000.v.

 
01737 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
01738     if(reset_n == 1'b0) begin
01739         pc <= 32'd0;
01740         pc_valid <= 32'd0;
01741     end
01742     else begin
01743         if(pc_control == `PC_FROM_RESULT)                       pc = result;
01744         else if(pc_control == `PC_INCR_BY_2)                    pc = pc + 32'd2;
01745         else if(pc_control == `PC_INCR_BY_4)                    pc = pc + 32'd4;
01746         else if(pc_control == `PC_INCR_BY_SIZE)                 pc = (size[2] == 1'b0) ? pc + 32'd2 : pc + 32'd4;
01747         else if(pc_control == `PC_FROM_PREFETCH_IR)             pc = prefetch_ir[47:16];
01748         else if(pc_control == `PC_INCR_BY_2_IN_MAIN_LOOP && prefetch_ir_valid == 1'b1 && decoder_trap == 8'd0 && stop_flag == 1'b0)
01749                                                                 pc = pc + 32'd2;
01750         if(pc[0] == 1'b0)  pc_valid <= pc;
01751     end
01752 end

Definition at line 1764 of file ao68000.v.

 
01764 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
01765     if(reset_n == 1'b0) begin
01766         size <= 2'b00;
01767     end
01768     else begin
01769         // BYTE
01770         size[0] <= (size_control == `SIZE_BYTE)
01771                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_3) && (ir[7:6] == 2'b00))
01772                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_4) && (ir[13:12] == 2'b01))
01773                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_6) && (ir[5:3] != 3'b000));
01774         // WORD
01775         size[1] <= (size_control == `SIZE_WORD)
01776                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_1) && (ir[7:6] == 2'b00))
01777                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_1_PLUS) && (ir[7:6] == 2'b10))
01778                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_2) && (ir[6] == 1'b0))
01779                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_3) && (ir[7:6] == 2'b01))
01780                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_4) && (ir[13:12] == 2'b11))
01781                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_5) && (ir[8] == 1'b0));
01782         // LONG
01783         size[2] <= (size_control == `SIZE_LONG)
01784                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_1) && (ir[7:6] != 2'b00))
01785                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_1_PLUS) && (ir[7:6] != 2'b10))
01786                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_2) && (ir[6] == 1'b1))
01787                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_3) && (ir[7] == 1'b1))
01788                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_4) && (ir[12] == 1'b0))
01789                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_5) && (ir[8] == 1'b1))
01790                 | ((size_control == `SIZE_6) && (ir[5:3] == 3'b000));
01791     end
01792 end

Definition at line 1873 of file ao68000.v.

 
01873 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
01874     if(reset_n == 1'b0)                                         address <= 32'b0;
01875     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_INCR_BY_SIZE)           address <= ((size[0]) && ea_reg == 3'b111) ? address + 32'd2 : address + {29'd0,size};
01876     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_DECR_BY_SIZE)           address <= ((size[0]) && ea_reg == 3'b111) ? address - 32'd2 : address - {29'd0,size};
01877     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_INCR_BY_2)              address <= address + 32'd2;
01878     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_FROM_AN_OUTPUT)         address <= An_output;
01879     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_FROM_BASE_INDEX_OFFSET) address <= address + index + offset;
01880     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_FROM_IMM_16)            address <= { {16{prefetch_ir[79]}}, prefetch_ir[79:64] };
01881     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_FROM_IMM_32)            address <= prefetch_ir[79:48];
01882     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_FROM_PC_INDEX_OFFSET)   address <= pc_valid + index + offset;
01883     else if(address_control == `ADDRESS_FROM_TRAP)              address <= {22'b0, trap[7:0], 2'b0};
01884 end
